attributes.action: Provide immediately  £1.5m to replace Deerness Bridge on C18 in County Durham
attributes.background:
This bridge is a vital semi rural link for families and businesses in County Durham. It is now unsafe for use as the replacement of this 114 year old bridge was hindered by County Durham Councils lack of strategy and funding
These lack of funds will delay replacement by more than 1 year by DCC
attributes.additional_details:
http://m.durhamadvertiser.co.uk/news/14501015.Anger_over_one_way_system_following_closure_of_Deerness_Bridge/?ref=rss&utm_source=dlvr.it&utm_medium=facebook

Facebook page : Deerness Bridge action group

attributes.action: Publish risk assessments for hydrocarbon exploration and extraction in the U.K.
attributes.background: Risk assessments for hydrocarbon exploration and extraction (Fracking) should be made available for local authorities and communities thereunder. It is fundamental for everyone to have information about personal safety and health risks associated with neighbouring and close by commercial ventures.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.whatdotheyknow.com/request/visibility_of_insurance_policies?nocache=incoming-758982#incoming-758982

attributes.action: Stop the closure of our St Leonards Community Hospital Dorset.
attributes.background: The St Leonards Community hospital was donated to the Health authority in Dorset when the Americans went back to the USA after WW2.  Local feeling is that we need this Hospital.please help to save one of our community Hospitals thank you.
attributes.additional_details:
We have worked hard for our community hospital and it is usually 98% full this helps with bed blocking here in Dorset.

http://www.stleonardsfriends.co.uk/ for more information.

attributes.action: Refine the ATC radio traffic act to allow UK listening
attributes.background:
Refine the ATC radio traffic act to allow UK listening
Current law states you can only listen to transmissions meant for general reception. This means the general public can not listen to ATC traffic in the UK (but can listen to ATC in the US!).
attributes.additional_details:
A licence is not required for a radio receiver as long as it is not capable of transmission as well (The Wireless Telegraphy Apparatus (Receivers) (Exemption) Regulations 1989 (SI 1989 No 123).

Although it is not illegal to sell, buy or own a scanning or other receiver in the UK, it must only be used to listen to transmissions meant for GENERAL RECEPTION. 
It is an offence to listen to any other radio services unless you are authorised by a designated person to do so.

attributes.action: Make All Ministers Publish Their Tax Returns
attributes.background: In an interview today the Leader of the Opposition Jeremy Corbyn stated "The public need to have confidence that their representatives in Parliament... are getting their income from honest and open sources".
attributes.additional_details:
The British public deserve to know whether their representatives in  government are matching words with personal action and taking individual responsibility with their finances.

Sign this petition to secure a greater level of transparency and promote the ethical accountability of government ministers.

attributes.action: Launch a Parliamentary enquiry into the Whirlpool Tumble Dryer recall
attributes.background: Last year Whirlpool announced a recall of 5 million Tumble Dryers to resolve the risk of a fire.  Their Customer Service dept has been overwhelmed.  The wait for the fix is now 11 months during this the advice from is to continue to use the appliance but not unattended.  Fires are happening.

attributes.action: Integrate economics and politics classes into the National Curriculum
attributes.background: The reaction of many regretful voters on social media to the post-publication by tabloids of the effects of a 'leave' vote following the EU referendum underlines the need for students of all backgrounds to receive an unbiased but informed education on the important subjects of politics and economics
attributes.additional_details: Please don't let voters continue to engage in guesswork or be swayed by hysteria or bad politics when it comes to their voting preferences. Give our future generations the opportunity to learn about the intricacies of politics, what the major political parties stand for through examination of their manifestos. Show them that these manifestos are rarely manifested. Show them that politics is fraught with lies and, more importantly, how to wade through these lies and make an informed choice.

attributes.action: Rename Manchester Victoria railway station Manchester Victoria Wood station.
attributes.background: Victoria Wood was a much loved comedian born and raised in Manchester. Her humour was distinctive to the city and she set her TV series 'Dinner Ladies' there. Following her death in 2016, Manchester Victoria railway station was renamed in her honour for an hour. It should be renamed permanently.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/whats-on/whats-on-news/victoria-station-become-victoria-wood-11404138

attributes.action: Change the questions on pip benefit to cover mental health illness
attributes.background: People who have mental health issues getting refused pip because the questions are set for physical health and not mental health

attributes.action: An URGENT review of the rates Local Authorities pay for adult residential care.
attributes.background: Adult social care is severely under funded. Local authority net spending on social care has dropped by an average of 2.2% a year since 2009 despite day to day living costs increasing. The rates provided to operators to care for LA funded residents are woefully inadequate & many homes risk closure.
attributes.additional_details:
This recent BBC report shows that 5000 care homes in the UK are now on the brink of closure. 

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-36200855

Whilst councils are undoubtedly under extreme financial pressure, in failing to keep up with the rising costs of care, they are putting businesses, jobs & the lives of the UK's most vulnerable residents at risk!

We therefore ask you to review the rates paid by local authorities for adult residential care in the UK as a matter of urgency, before it is too late!

attributes.action: Schools to consider needs of all pupils when addressing attendance & behaviour
attributes.background:
The Department for Education and Nick Gibb released this publication on 24th March 2016. https://www.gov.uk/government/news/just-one-day-off-can-hamper-childrens-life-chances.
The content of this publication is concerning for pupils and their parents. It ignores individual needs and circumstances.
attributes.additional_details:
What if money was spent on finding ways to help students with challenges rather than simply thinking up more punitive strategies (as if schools don't already use enough of these already)?

We supposedly live in a society where respect, patience, tolerance and cooperation are all values very much embraced (and taught in schools).

Many children have been out of school and receiving minimal education for a long time through no fault of their own or their parents. Families need help, not punishment

attributes.action: Review the Child Maintainence Service and make it fair for honest paying parents
attributes.background: The CMS are only 1 sided when it comes to a claim. I want the government to review the powers they have and allow for common sense when making decisions that affect any honest, paying and hard working parent.
attributes.additional_details:
Example. A claiming parent can say the paying parent doesn't have the child overnight when in fact they do. The paying parent then has to pay for solicitors and court costs just to get paperwork saying they do. The claiming parent therefore keeping higher payments.

Example. A claiming parent can say the paying parent isn't paying and without warning, the CMS will start a Deduction of Earnings taking an extra 20% of a paying parents wage (plus admin fees) for themselves. Even if they are paying

attributes.action: Delay invoking Article 50 until Expert Commission reviews impact of Brexit on UK
attributes.background: MPs should respect the wishes of the 63% of the electorate who did not vote to leave the EU, and demand that Article 50 not be invoked until Brexit proponents provide a fully developed plan for the process of leaving the EU, followed by an Expert Commission to assess its economic and social impact.
attributes.additional_details: "Leave campaign" MPs claimed that leaving the EU would mean: more money for the NHS; improved job prospects for UK residents through lower immigration; greater economic prosperity through reduced red-tape and renegotiated trading agreements with the EU and the rest of the world. Since the Referendum, these claims have been significantly reduced, and there is no Brexit plan. Parliament now needs to take responsibility to ensure that the outcome is as beneficial as possible for the British people.

attributes.action: Bring the RAF and Navy Tattoo policy in line with the revised Army policy.
attributes.background: The British Army on 1 August 2014 brought in a revised Tattoo policy which allows for body art to be displayed on hands and rear of the neck.  The Army and Capita, who assisted with the revised policy, agree that tattoos do not inhibit operational functionality or compromise the Army's image.
attributes.additional_details:
New MoD figures show the three services are short of nearly 6,400 trained personnel, more than 4,000 of them soldiers.
Year 13/14 The Army rejected 336 applications because of offensive or inappropriately placed tattoos, as well as piercings.
Elizabeth Lee from Capita said: 'Tattoos have become increasingly acceptable and common in society, including among potential recruits considering a career in the Army. 'Greater flexibility over tattoos on the neck or hands will remove a barrier for a number of people currently interested in applying for a job in the Army, without compromising its image as a professional force.'

attributes.action: Get Southern trains contract cancelled in the South East
attributes.background: Tired of the excuses and the prices paid for train services on these routes only to have trains cancelled, constantly late and you cannot even get a refund on days Southern did not even have a train running all day. Let us get Southern's contract cancelled as soon as possible!

attributes.action: Parents must be allowed access to their children unless a court rules otherwise.
attributes.background:
This petition is asking for it to be made illegal for one parent to deny the other access, without them being ruled as unfit by a court. 
 
 This petition is designed to protect children from the emotional damage that occurs when parents use them as a weapon against each other.
attributes.additional_details: Local authorities can't make one parent allow the other access. The time it takes for one parent to regain access via the courts can leave lasting damage between a parent and child, who have then lost valuable time during crucial developmental stages, which can never be reclaimed. Unless there is good reason, such as the police suspecting physical abuse, then contact should not be denied, and the local authorities should have the power to ensure access is arranged by law, even if it's supervised

attributes.action: Make it illegal to sell petrol/diesel engine cars in the UK from 2025
attributes.background:
This is already law in Holland and UK needs to follow ASAP
So only Electric Cars would be available for sale from that date.

attributes.action: Remove EU flags from public buildings immediately because of the EU result.
attributes.background: We, the people of the UK, have decided to remove ourselves from the European Union via a referendum. We now demand the removal of the symbol of the EU, namely their flag, to be removed from all public buildings with immediate effect.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for doctors to send males letters about a PSA BLOOD TEST
attributes.background: I want action as i find women get reminders to have regular smear tests done but males who are reaching the age of 50 have to ask to have a psa test done to check for prostate cancer and not alot of men know about this test

attributes.action: Require Coroners, in suicide cases, to explore if best practice was followed.
attributes.background: Worldwide studies show that the involvement of family, friends & carers helps to reduce suicide. The document, http://bit.ly/1VUKDI5, agreed by all the professional bodies, advocates that unless there are good reasons not to do so, consent should always be sought to involve family, friends & carers.
attributes.additional_details: Rebecca Kelsall, see http://dailym.ai/1UWGJNx, died because GPs failed to follow RCGP guidelines CR152 and the NICE guidelines CG90 and CG91. This showed that the health service can be slow in keeping abreast with latest guidelines. As coroners have a duty to investigate whether death was avoidable, they are best placed to monitor whether best practice guidelines are followed.  As such, coroners should persistently ask clinicians and others for reports about processes and procedures followed.

attributes.action: Reinstate compensation to sufferers of pleural plaque
attributes.background: I have been fighting for justice since 2007 with a number of trips to Parliament to speak to MPs asking for there support when the law lords sided with insurance companies to stop paying compensation to sufferers negligently exposed to asbestos
attributes.additional_details: Sir I am president of Swansea boilermakers gmb union and have had two early day motions put by my local MPs to no avail for justice  for all .I represented ship wrights boilermakers & blacksmiths who worked during the war on the mulberry harbour and flaying chains on tanks to destroy mines on the Normandy beaches who suffered  through being negligently exposed    to asbestos .lets not fore-get  them and give justice to all B T Legg.

attributes.action: Demand MPs to hold an anonymous poll on the EU Referendum (Stay/Leave)
attributes.background: MPs need to have their say on the EU Referendum led by their conscience to do the best for Britain. First, it is better to hold an anonymous poll so that MPs are not influenced by career ambitions of being re-elected (support their electoral area outcome even if they are fundamentally against it).
attributes.additional_details:
The EU Referendum had an advisory role. The outcome was compromised by misleading information from the Leave campaign, topics included: NHS, immigration, free movement and the cost of the UK’s EU membership. Millions of people didn't know what they voted for. 
This anonymous poll is designed to help MPs understand where they stand and proceed accordingly as the period of uncertainty is unquestionably bad for the economy.
MPs are required to vote in Britain's best interest by law.

attributes.action: Child Benefit to be taxed based on household income and not one parents salary
attributes.background: Currently if a single person earns over £50k a year they have to pay a tax charge on child benefit, earn over £60k and you have to pay more tax than child benefit so there is no point in claiming. However a couple can have a joint income of £98k (£49k each) and receive the full Child Benefit.
attributes.additional_details:
I feel very strongly about this and the difference in receiving or not receiving Child Benefit may influence financial decisions for many families.

Child Benefit is £20.70 per week for one child and £13.79 for an additional child. For some families this makes a huge difference. 

Why should families with a household income of less than £98k receive their full entitlement to Child Benefit and yet a family with one working parent who earns over £48k not?

attributes.action: Regulate Private Hire Fares
attributes.background: To regulate Private hire fares to minimum wage. To make sure that all operators follow them correctly.

attributes.action: Prevent any Council setting up charges for Park Run or any similar event.
attributes.background: Little Stoke Parish Council have begun to charge runners £1 to participate in its local Park Run. An event which helps and encourages people to get out and run or walk 5km once a week.
attributes.additional_details: Park Run is a free global organised run and should be kept that way.

attributes.action: Play an active role in achieving a peaceful resolution to the Kashmir dispute.
attributes.background: The Kashmir dispute has not been resolved for over 7 decades. In recent days, we have seen further Indian atrocities committed against the people of Kashmir leaving many dead. The UK government must play its role in pressuring the Indian government to halt its hostilities and to reach a resolution.
attributes.additional_details:
We petition the UK government to:

1) Pressurise the Indian government to halt its hostilities in Indian occupied Kashmir, against the people of Kashmir.

2) Play an active diplomatic role to reach a peaceful settlement of the Kashmir dispute.

3) Ensure, through diplomacy, that the UN Resolutions regarding a free and fair referendum in Kashmir are enforced. Thus, the people of Kashmir may exercise self-determination once and for all without the influence of any State in/out of the region.

attributes.action: Pass a law requiring Councils to publish  Development Control Committees votes.
attributes.background: These committees take decisions affecting our lives. Their decisions can be worth £millions to developers. The current system where votes are counted on a show of hands is unsatisfactory. These committees are open to corruption. Parliament must pass a law requiring Councillor's votes be published.
attributes.additional_details: This is a zero cost proposal; no public money needs to be spent. If this proposal is adopted these committees will be more democratic and more worthy of trust from the people that they represent. Cynicism is rife regarding local government Councillors. This proposal will go some way to reducing this. Councillors should be accountable to the people who vote for them. How can they be held to account if we can't know how they vote?

attributes.action: Reveal how many detainees reported being sexually assaulted/raped in Yarl’s Wood
attributes.background: In response to a Freedom of Information request, The Home Office refused to reveal how many detainees have been sexually assaulted or raped inside Yarl’s Wood on the grounds that “disclosure would, or would be likely to, prejudice the commercial interests” of people involved with running Yarl’s Wood
attributes.additional_details:
The Independent submitted the FOI because many reports of sexual assault & abuse have been made against staff at Yarl’s Wood. Chief prisons inspector Nick Hardwick called the centre  a “place of national concern”. The UN’s special rapporteur on violence against women, Rashida Manjoo said she'd been refused entry to the centre by the Government
The Immigration Minister & Home Secretary must reveal the numbers, & stop putting the commercial interests of Serco above human rights of vulnerable people

attributes.action: Get Pam Carlson's Deportation OVERTURNED!
attributes.background: Pam has lived in the UK for 7 YEARS, she came over on a Domestic Visa, but split from her long term partner, therefore being deported. She works, lives and contributes to this country as well as being an avid fund raiser for animal charities. She does nothing but GIVE, never taken a penny from theUK
attributes.additional_details: What more information do you need, other than she works, lives, and has a LIFE here in the UK. She fund raises, she helps others, and she is one of the nicest people anyone has ever known.

attributes.action: KS2 Reading SATs was unfair on pupils & shouldn’t be counted in performance data
attributes.background: Unlike other Key Stage 2 subjects, the Reading paper differed significantly from the sample test. We fully support a drive to increase standards, but the level of vocabulary was above beyond most 11 year olds. This poor communication of expectations by the DfE should not punish pupils or schools.
attributes.additional_details: The number of inferential questions was far higher, with fewer literal, than the sample. Both were inaccessible to lower attainers, who couldn’t show skills learned. In past/sample tests pupils found key words in a question to retrieve information/infer answers. This test required pupils find synonyms of key words. Teachers would have taught this had it been indicated in sample materials/Programme of Study. It’s unfair to test children on skills for which there was no indication to teachers.

attributes.action: Protect the financially vulnerable with a system which blocks lending.
attributes.background: Currently, in the UK, we do not have a system that protects people that are financially vulnerable and who do not have capacity to make such important financial decisions. Meaning vulnerable adults can be signed up to credit agreements accumulating debt without the carers knowledge.
attributes.additional_details:
We appreciate it would be impossible to vet every person who applies for lending, yet we would like the credit reference agencies to apply markers to credit files to prevent lending to vulnerable people being agreed. 

These could be applied by carers or medical professionals either on a temporary or permanent basis. We believe this would not only provide relief for the carer but also protection for all vulnerable adults no matter who the lender may be.

attributes.action: Make the documents relating to David Kelly's death public
attributes.background:
David Kelly's death, a UN weapons inspector, shortly followed the WMD inspections in 2003. In 2010, the government deemed the circumstances around his death 'should be kept secret' for 70 years.
Following the Chilcot report today, I feel these documents should be released in the public interest.

attributes.action: Ban the making and receiving of all phone calls whilst driving.
attributes.background: Cars kill. Research clearly shows a person is distracted from driving and their reaction times are slowed if on the phone, even if they are using it hands-free. No phone call is worth a distraction that could cause death. Help save lives.
attributes.additional_details:
Evidence shows making and receiving calls distracts drivers and slows their reaction times. A caller can always leave a message and call or be called back. If it is important they will be in touch.
 
Radio 5 live programme ( starts 8.30 mins) 
http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/b07dj0zj

attributes.action: Citizenship Granted to Ex-Servicemen & Women after serving in the British Forces
attributes.background: Stop sending Ex-Service Man & Women after serving in the British Army,Navy & Royal Air Force.Especially Foreign & Commonwealth Soldiers.After giving there life to Queen n the United Kingdom,domestic & Abroad,Iraq,Afghanistan & Bosnia and other places

attributes.action: Change law to make  Dog Owners responsible for their Dogs that attack Pets
attributes.background: Too many pets are being attacked by out of control dogs and nothing can be done about it as it's not a police matter.
attributes.additional_details: So let's see if we can change the law, as since 1871 the law says a dog on dog attack is not a police matter. This petition is to see if we can get the law changed that  owners of dogs with a history of aggression/attack MUST be on lead or muzzled if level of aggression is high in open/public spaces.

attributes.action: Call a general election immediately after Conservative party leadership decided
attributes.background: Labour & Conservatives contested the 2015 General Election with policies based on continuing EU membership.David Cameron has now resigned.The political landscape is now changed.Parties must devise new manifestos based on EU exit & transition & put to the electorate to decide who leads us through it.

attributes.action: Set up a Royal Commission to look at the NHS provision of care.
attributes.background: It is clear the politicians and clinicians are unable to decide what the tax pound should be spent on in the NHS.  The impasse can only be broken by a Royal Commission looking at the NHS. Only a Royal Commission can decide what the NHS,  in EU parlance, 'should', 'shall' and 'should not' provide.

attributes.action: Hold a Referendum on key Brexit deals BEFORE giving Article 50 notice
attributes.background: There is no democracy without informed consent. Voters did not know before 23 June the terms on which we would leave the EU, the global trade deals which would be done or our immigration policy following Brexit. These must be agreed and voted on BEFORE we give irrevocable Art 50 notice to leave.
attributes.additional_details:
Article 50 is a one way street.  Once it gives one, that state must leave the EU after 2 years (or more if the remaining 27 agree).  We do not need to give notice until we KNOW that the terms we would have (both with the EU and the rest of the world) would be better outside than inside the EU.

We should promptly negotiate with the EU and others and put these deals to the electorate.  Only if the electorate votes in favour should we leave.  A statute should stop notice being given otherwise.

attributes.action: Veterans injury compensation to be protected and disregarded for benefits!!
attributes.background:
If a veteran recieves compensation as a result of an injury caused whilst serving our country - i believe it should be protected and disregarded for benefit entitlement.
Recieving compensation shouldn't effect a veteran claiming benefits inc ESA, JSA and housing when they return to civilian life.
attributes.additional_details:
At present compensation is classed as savings. If a veteran recieves over £6,000, their entitlement to benefit may be affected  (reduced). If a veteran recieves more than £16,000 then they may not be entitled to the benefit at all. 

Veterans should be able to choose how they use their compensaton, and not be turned away for benefits and expected to live off it!

Help protect our veterans and their compensaton by signing my petition in support, thankyou :)

attributes.action: Make not paying a taxi/private hire soiling fee a criminal offence.
attributes.background:
Why is the soiling fee not a criminal offence when not paying the fare on the meter is a criminal offence.

So many times drivers are put off the road while they get there car cleaned and back up to standard, why should the driver be out of pocket when it was no fault of the driver.

attributes.action: Pressure public establishments to provide baby changing facilities for men.
attributes.background:
There are still many public facilities where child changing facilities are either housed in the ladies toilets or simply not available to men at all. 
We urge the government to pressure businesses of all sizes to ensure men have equal opportunity to access changing facilities for their children.

attributes.action: Please make it LAW to Scan all animals on a regular basis at the vets
attributes.background:
Currently in the UK they're are no laws with dogs/cats/animals getting scanned on a regular basis when they visit the vets. 
There is very sadly a big problem in the UK with dogs/cats getting stolen or going missing. Please Sign & Share to help this happen. 
Shocking that it is not law already.
attributes.additional_details:
All vets need to scan on new appointments, and scan on a regular basis. The Microchip can also disappear or move.
Some people find them and do not hand them in to the right authorities(dog warden etc) like it is law to do. 
My personal experience in the past each time my dogs have been scanned I have had to request it. This should not be the case.
Luckily I did that, as if my dog did go missing I would of never of got him back as his chip vanished. Dogs have a chip for a REASON
Dogs' are Family

attributes.action: Reduce the retirement age for workers in physical jobs.
attributes.background: In physical jobs people's bodies don't last to the new and ever increasing retirement age. Builders, postmen, farm workers are just a few examples. In my Job (postal industry) workers have worn out joints and limbs after a relitvly short time in the industry. Some will retire almost crippled.

attributes.action: To add a 6 month get out clause to every privately rented housing contract.
attributes.background: Privately rented tenancys are increasingly 24 months with a 'no get out' clause resulting in massive financial loss and stress to private renters. Regardless of reason, be it issues with the property or change in personal circumstances, the right to move must protect human rights.
attributes.additional_details: I have support from the housing charity 'Shelter' and facts and alarming figures of private renters in need.

attributes.action: Stop foreign men using marriage to live in the UK.
attributes.background: Marriage is a loophole in visa constraints. Abolishing the spouse visa would be for the common good, because England is over-crowded and the UK has more young men than young women. It would not prevent women from marrying foreign men because they can live in the husband's country, as is normal.
attributes.additional_details: This loophole for foreign men was closed in 1969 but was re-opened by the next Labour Home Secretary. The Conservatives promised to close the loophole again in their 1979 election manifesto, but did not keep their promise.

attributes.action: Abolish psychiatric electroconvulsive therapy – ECT - electroshock to the brain
attributes.background: ECT causes brain cell death, brain bleed and swelling. It can cause permanent memory loss, cognitive impairment and even death. It can trigger suicide. ECT machines have never been independently inspected or approved for medical safety, not even by the regulators for the UK - MHRA or the US – FDA.
attributes.additional_details: Electroconvulsive therapy (ECT) (electroshock) is a psychiatric procedure where up to 400 volts is put through the brain for up to 8 seconds causing an epileptic fit purportedly to relieve mental distress. Mainly given to women and the elderly, sometimes to children and often without consent. Patients are rarely fully informed about the potential harm. Dr Peter Breggin states ECT produces a ‘closed head injury high’ www.ectresources.org. Abolish ECT. www.speakoutagainstpsychiatry.org @soapgroup

attributes.action: Make food manufacturers to declare and label their food halal or kosher
attributes.background: It is in the interests of the people to give them the information about what they eat so they can make an informed decision about the food they eat.  To deny this is denying peoples right to choose.  People have the right to know what they are buying and nothing should be hidden from the consumer.
attributes.additional_details: This work both ways, some people are strongly against the way in which animals are treated before their death and the way in which they are slaughtered.  They do not wish to have any part in the consumption of halal and kosher products.   However, the moslem community do support this and would probably feel better knowing that their food is slaughtered to "halal" guidelines and I am sure the Jewish community would prefer to buy products that are marked "Kosher".

attributes.action: Cut Foreign Aid & use the money to increase the defence budget and armed forces
attributes.background:
We believe the the Government should reduce the Foreign Aid budget back to £8.4bn, the level it was at in 2010.
The Foreign Aid budget is set to rise to almost £16bn by 2020.
We believe this additional funding should be moved to beef up our defence capabilities and our marvellous armed forces.
attributes.additional_details:
The Foreign Aid budget is too high and is subject to abuse.
We believe that the budget should be reduced to £8.4bn & the commitment of a minimum of 2% GDP on defence spending is increased.
Our armed forces are amongst the best in the world.
We should reflect this by boosting our defence budget & spending on our armed forces.
In an ever more dangerous world, we should spend more on beefing up our defence budget.
We believe that the best way to achieve this is to cut Foreign Aid & boost Defence

attributes.action: Reduce state pension age for construction workers
attributes.background: I,ve been an electrician in construction since i was 16 and constantly hear about many colleagues having very little or, no retirement due to ill health caused by the exposure to chemicals, asbestos etc.  and the physical toll to our bodies, especially joints, due to the nature of our work. Help us.
attributes.additional_details: There are many life expectancy studies, relating to all occupations , that will back up this petition and the HSE will confirm the occupational hazards and illnesses, that construction workers are exposed to on a daily basis. The studies do vary with data suggesting that construction workers die between 6  to 10 years earlier than people in white collar office occupations. Construction workers morally deserve a period of rest,  just as much as other workers do, at the end of our shorter lives.

attributes.action: Declare the actions of Daesh against minorities as genocide
attributes.background: Daesh is committing genocide against those who do not subscribe to their mis-interpretation of Islam. Notably against the minority: Christians, Yezidi, Turkmen, Shabak, Kurds & Shia. The UK must follow the example of the European Parliament and formally acknowledge the genocide, so it can be stopped
